Assignment 4 - Data Driven Storytelling

Code 
import folium
import pandas as pd

# Sample Data: Replace with your actual data source
data = {
    'Country': ['United States', 'India', 'China', 'Brazil'],
    'Latitude': [37.0902, 20.5937, 35.8617, -14.2350],
    'Longitude': [-95.7129, 78.9629, 104.1954, -51.9253],
    'CO2_emissions': [15.5, 2.1, 7.4, 2.3]  # fictitious emissions data in tonnes per capita
}

df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Create a map centered around a global view
m = folium.Map(location=[20, 0], zoom_start=2)

# Add a color scale
def color_scale(amount):
    if amount > 15:
        return 'red'
    elif amount > 5:
        return 'orange'
    else:
        return 'green'

# Add markers
for i in range(len(df)):
    folium.Circle(
        location=[df.iloc[i]['Latitude'], df.iloc[i]['Longitude']],
        radius=200000*df.iloc[i]['CO2_emissions'],
        color=color_scale(df.iloc[i]['CO2_emissions']),
        fill=True,
        fill_color=color_scale(df.iloc[i]['CO2_emissions'])
    ).add_to(m)

m
Make this Notebook Trusted to load map: File -> Trust Notebook
Code 
import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd

# Sample Data
data = {
    'Country': ['United States', 'India', 'China', 'Brazil'],
    'Latitude': [37.0902, 20.5937, 35.8617, -14.2350],
    'Longitude': [-95.7129, 78.9629, 104.1954, -51.9253],
    'CO2_emissions': [15.5, 2.1, 7.4, 2.3]  # fictitious emissions data in tonnes per capita
}

df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Create the map
fig = px.scatter_geo(df,
                     lat='Latitude',
                     lon='Longitude',
                     color='CO2_emissions',  # Color of dots
                     hover_name='Country',  # Hover text
                     size='CO2_emissions',  # Size of dots
                     projection='natural earth',  # Map style
                     title='Global CO2 Emissions per Capita')  # Title of the map

fig.show()
